newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Troops called out after Pakistan mosque attack.
newsitem.headline: Troops called out after Pakistan mosque attack.

text.p: Pakistani troops were deployed in armoured vehicles to quell unrest in the city of Multan on Monday after gunmen killed 21 people in a Sunni Moslem mosque, witnesses said.
They said the soldiers were enforcing an undeclared curfew in the vicinity of the Al-Khair mosque, where angry protesters earlier fought police and stoned Shi'ite Moslem neighbourhoods.
Gunmen sprayed automatic weapons fire at worshippers at dawn prayers on Monday, killing 21 people and wounding many more, including boys studying at a Koranic school at the mosque.
The attack followed the murder of a leader of a militant Shi'ite group in the nearby town of Bahawalpur on Sunday.
